Posts.Content: Aug 12, 2011 11:18AM Southamptonmom wrote: Go to your local natural food store. They have aloe juice both in flavors and unflavored. Also, I found gaviscon to help in addtion to prilosec or nexium and pepcid. Lots of luck. Heartburn is horrible to deal with when it doesn't go away!
Posts.Title: Any tips for heartburn CoolBreeze LindaVA

Posts.Content: Feb 4, 2012 12:38PM Southamptonmom wrote: I got the essential light 3E right and left breasts (fuller on the outside as well as on top) in a size 9, and she told me to flip them and wear the right on the left and left on the right. It's much better than anything else I've tried. I still prefer to wear the puff in a coobie bra though. Also, if you get the bra size that is recommended for the size form, the bra looks too big. I got a smaller cup size bra, and although the pockets stretch out along with the prosthetic, it looks much better when you have a shirt on.

Can anyone list Taxol and Herceptin Side effects? Southamptonmom Southamptonmom

Posts.Content: Aug 25, 2011 04:48PM Southamptonmom wrote: I am switching hospitals, and with the chemo shortage, I will be getting Abraxane and herceptin starting tomorrow. I did have to fight the insurance company to switch! I've have the "cattle prod" pain with the taxol, and bone achiness. I get heart palpitations as well, and they were intensive for a few days, but have now calmed down. I'm definitely not as tired as I was on AC, but I'm not myself. I'm hoping each week will bring some renewed energy! I am having neoadjuvant therapy, and can't stand that I've not had surgery yet. Lornar, best wishes for a successful surgery and an end to the long drives for treatment. Congrats! Lindaqs, I was told no neulasta on taxol because it does not cause a drop in WBCs, but my last taxol (#2) my counts were the lowest so far (3.2).
Posts.Title: Can anyone list Taxol and Herceptin Side effects? Southamptonmom Southamptonmom

Posts.Content: Aug 1, 2011 02:10PM Southamptonmom wrote: I was offered AC x 4 over 8 weeks, then taxol and herceptin weekly x 12, surgery/rads, then herceptin every 3 weeks to finish out the year or TCH every 3 weeks x 6, surgery/rads, then herceptin every 3 weeks to finish the year. MO stated that AC route was more effective, but had greater implications on future heart failure. However, I was given the choice. I chose the AC route and although it's been no cake walk, it's doable. Lots of healing energy to you!
